<<<api>>>: Activity.findViewById
<<<code>>>: private static class MyHandler extends Handler {}
private final MyHandler mHandler = new MyHandler();
private int mImageIndex = 0;
private int[] mImageIds = {R.drawable.img1, R.drawable.img2, R.drawable.img3};
public static class MyRunnable implements Runnable {
    private final WeakReference<Activity> mActivity;
    private final int[] mImageIds;
    private int mImageIndex;
    public MyRunnable(Activity activity, int[] imageIds, int imageIndex) {
        mActivity = new WeakReference<>(activity);
        mImageIds = imageIds;
        mImageIndex = imageIndex;
    }
    @Override
    public void run() throws Exception {
        Activity activity = mActivity.get();
        if (activity != null) {
            ImageView imageView = (ImageView) activity.findViewById(R.id.imageView);
            imageView.setImageResource(mImageIds[mImageIndex]);
            mImageIndex = (mImageIndex + 1) % mImageIds.length;
            mHandler.postDelayed(this, 500);
        }
    }
}
private MyRunnable mRunnable = new MyRunnable(this, mImageIds, mImageIndex);
public void startAnimation() {
    mHandler.post(mRunnable);
}
public void stopAnimation() {
    mHandler.removeCallbacks(mRunnable);
}
<<<explanation>>>: This solution uses a Handler and a Runnable to change the image every half second. The image index is incremented and wrapped around to create a continuous loop. The startAnimation() method starts the animation and the stopAnimation() method stops it. The ImageView is updated using the setImageResource() method.
